description: Identifies instances where an author attributes phantom premises or implications to their critic that aren't present in the text. Detects strawman constructions and unfounded imputations.
researcher_question: Where does the author attribute claims to the critic that aren't actually in the critique?

leaps.author_claim: string - what author says critic implies/argues
leaps.analysis: string - how the attribution is unfounded

extraction.core_question: Where does the author attribute claims to the critic that aren't in the text?
extraction_steps: IDENTIFY ATTRIBUTIONS: Find where author characterizes what critic argues or implies
LOCATE ACTUAL TEXT: Find corresponding passages in critic's actual work
COMPARE: Assess whether attribution matches the actual text
CLASSIFY LEAP TYPE: Determine if strawman, phantom premise, etc.
DOCUMENT ACTUAL ARGUMENT: State what the critic actually argues
extraction.special_instructions: Focus on cases where the gap between attribution and actual text is demonstrable through quotation.

concretization.naming_guidance: Name by the phantom premise attributed
